forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 51. Southwest wind around 10 mph.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 61, with temperatures falling to around 58 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 8 to 12 mph.

weather_report:
As evening unfurls its gentle embrace over Downtown San Francisco, the sky hovers with a thick, mottled cloud cover, hinting at the possibility of a night sprinkled with elusive star glimpses. The air carries a crispness, settling around 51 degrees, inviting a layer or two for comfort. The southwest breeze whispers softly, its cool tendrils reminding those wandering the streets of the city’s iconic chill, characteristic of the season. 

Looking ahead to tomorrow, the forecast stirs an enticing scene. The morning will greet residents and visitors alike with the promise of sunshine, albeit holding back just enough mystery as temperatures peak near 61 before retreating to a tarry 58 in the afternoon. While clarity will reign for a time, expect the occasional coastal fog to linger, maybe swirling around landmarks like the Golden Gate Bridge, offering fleeting moments of awe when the sun catches the mist.

As the night darkens, donned in a light jacket or sweater will provide just the right reprieve from the cool air. A perfect night unfolds for a casual stroll along the Embarcadero, or perhaps gathering at a cozy café, sipping a warm beverage while the city hums softly around you, evoking a sense of calm in this vibrant urban landscape.
